job title: Group Lead, Sr. Scientist - Cell Culture
job description:
Supervising Senior Scientist (Cell Culture)

Summary

Directly supervises a small team of scientists. Acts as lead on multiple programs.

Investigates, creates, and validates new scientific methodologies on multiple projects that meet client expectations.

Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other employees.

Responsibilities

Provides leadership to assigned staff and leads design of experimental plans

Works with Process Development and Manufacture groups to trouble-shoot process challenges.

Prepares protocols, reports, and test methods and writes SOPs.

Writing and revising of process development reports and technology transfer protocols as needed.

Project Management.

Acts as functional group technical lead on multiple programs, with responsibility for running those programs within own functional group.

Work cross functionally with Program management

Serves as primary contact with clients and provides regular communication of data and status. Leads relevant program team meetings.

Supervises Scientists at multiple levels.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree required (biology, chemistry, biochemistry, chemical engineering, or a related field.

Master's degree or PhD is highly desirable

Minimum of 8 years of experience related to pharmaceutical manufacturing, process, development or academic laboratory and that includes relevant industry and discipline experience.

With Master's degree, 6 years of experience related to pharmaceutical manufacturing, process, development or academic laboratory and that includes at least 2 years of relevant industry discipline experience.

With PhD, significant practical scientific application directly related to job responsibilities; related industry and discipline experience preferred.
